summary: This is a transcript of a voluntary interview conducted by the DOJ Office of the Inspector General with a Federal Bureau of Prisons lieutenant on September 1, 2021. The interview is part of an official OIG investigation into the death of inmate Jeffrey Epstein and surrounding circumstances, focusing on the movement of Epstein's cellmate, Efren Reyes, on August 9, 2019. This is a transcript of an interview conducted by the Department of Justice Office of the Inspector General with a correctional officer (referred to as 'Officer 1') regarding the events of August 9, 2019, at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC). The interview focuses on the transfer of inmate Efren Reyes (Jeffrey Epstein's cellmate) and the failure to assign Epstein a new cellmate, as well as a separate incident involving inmate Fernandez. The officer is questioned about procedures, notifications, and potential lapses in protocol.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: High-profile inmate in the Special Housing Unit (SHU). The interview investigates why he was not assigned a new cellmate after his cellmate, Efren Reyes, was transferred.

persons.name: Efren Reyes
persons.context: Inmate who was transferred from the MCC on August 9, 2019, leaving Jeffrey Epstein without a cellmate. His transfer and the handling of his departure are central to the interview.

persons.name: Officer 1
persons.role: Correctional Officer, OIC (Officer in Charge) in SHU
persons.context: The officer being interviewed. He was on duty in the SHU on August 9, 2019, and was involved in escorting Reyes and Epstein. He is questioned about his actions, notifications, and understanding of procedures regarding inmate transfers and cell assignments.

persons.name: Monge
persons.context: Officer who escorted inmates with Officer 1. He reportedly told Epstein he would need a new cellmate since Reyes was released.

persons.name: Fernandez
persons.context: Inmate involved in a separate incident on August 9, 2019, where he attempted to grab an unknown item from a visitor in the SHU visiting room. He was subsequently moved.

persons.name: Durant
persons.context: Mentioned as one of the operations and activities lieutenants who could have been notified about inmate movements and incidents.

persons.name: Perez
persons.context: Mentioned as one of the operations and activities lieutenants at the MCC on August 9, 2019.

persons.name: Cannata
persons.context: An operations lieutenant to whom Officer 1 sent an email regarding the Fernandez incident. Officer 1 is asked if he had any conversations with Cannata about Epstein or Reyes.

persons.name: Mr. Tupper
persons.context: One of the interviewers from the OIG conducting the questioning.

persons.name: Marci Bratton
persons.context: Person who certified the transcript as accurate.

connections.description: Reyes was Epstein's cellmate (celimate) in the Metropolitan Correctional Center.
Officer 1 was the OIC in the SHU where Epstein was housed and was involved in his escort to an attorney conference on August 9.
Officer 1 escorted Reyes downstairs for transfer on August 9, 2019, and was responsible for related notifications.
They worked together on escorts. Monge confirmed a conversation where Officer 1 told Epstein he would need a new cellmate.
Officer 1 sent an email report to Lieutenant Cannata regarding the Fernandez incident, indicating a chain of command relationship.

events.title: OIG Interview with BOP Lieutenant
events.description: The DOJ Office of the Inspector General conducts a voluntary, sworn interview with a Federal Bureau of Prisons lieutenant as part of its investigation into Jeffrey Epstein's death.

events.title: Efren Reyes Pre-removed from Unit
events.description: The daily log shows inmate Efren Reyes was 'pre-removed' at 8:35 AM, indicating he left the building with all belongings and was most likely not returning.

events.title: Prior Interview Regarding Epstein Matter
events.description: The BOP lieutenant was previously interviewed regarding the Epstein matter on this date.

events.title: Second Prior Interview with OIG Agents
events.description: The BOP lieutenant was interviewed again by the OIG agents on this date, prior to the September 1 interview.

events.title: Transfer of Efren Reyes
events.description: Inmate Efren Reyes is transferred from the MCC SHU to another institution (GO). He is listed as 'pre-remove' and 'WAB' (With All Belongings) on the daily log, indicating a permanent departure.

events.title: Failure to Assign Epstein New Cellmate
events.description: After Reyes's transfer, Jeffrey Epstein is left without a cellmate. Despite Officer 1 stating he notified others, no new cellmate is assigned to Epstein during the shift, leading to questions about procedural failures.

events.title: Fernandez Visiting Room Incident
events.description: Inmate Fernandez attempts to grab an unknown item from a visitor in the SHU visiting room. He is removed, and an incident report is filed. He is later moved to an R&D dry cell.

events.title: Reyes Transfer Email
events.description: An email is sent scheduling the transfer of Efren Reyes for August 9, 2019, including instructions for medication and summary.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC), New York, New York
U.S. Department of Justice Office of the Inspector General New York Field Office
28632 Roadside Drive, Suite 285, Agoura Hills, CA 91301 (Resolute Documentation Services)
Nine South visiting room (SHU visiting room)
keyFacts: The interview is part of the official DOJ OIG investigation (Case #2019-010614) into the death of Jeffrey Epstein and surrounding circumstances.
The interview focuses on the procedures and log entries related to the movement of Epstein's cellmate, Efren Reyes, who was 'pre-removed' or 'WAB' (with all belongings) on August 9, 2019.

The BOP lieutenant confirms that 'pre-remove' and 'WAB' are essentially the same, indicating an inmate is leaving the building and not expected to return, unlike a court appearance which would be logged differently.
The witness had been interviewed twice before regarding the Epstein matter, on August 19, 2019, and July 14, 2021.
The interview investigates a critical procedural lapse: why Jeffrey Epstein was not assigned a new cellmate after his cellmate, Efren Reyes, was transferred on August 9, 2019.
Officer 1, the OIC, states he told other officers (Monge and others) that Epstein needed a new cellmate, but those officers deny being told, creating a discrepancy.

Documentary evidence (emails, logs) shows Reyes was scheduled for transfer and was listed as 'WAB' (With All Belongings), which typically indicates a permanent departure, yet Officer 1 claims uncertainty about whether Reyes would return.

A separate incident involving inmate Fernandez on the same day is discussed, highlighting general operational chaos and unclear chains of responsibility for inmate movements and notifications within the MCC.
The interview reveals potential systemic issues in communication and accountability among MCC staff regarding inmate status changes and cell assignments.
